Class FigaroEnv.FigaroReplicationManager

The class used to control High Availability (HA) replication for the database environment.

View Source

AddRemoteHostSite(String, UInt32, Boolean)

Adds a new site to the FigaroReplicationManager's list of known sites.

Declaration
public void AddRemoteHostSite(string host, uint port, bool peerToPeer)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.String host

The site's host identification string.
System.UInt32 port

The port number on which the remote site is receiving.
System.Boolean peerToPeer

If true, configures client-to-client synchronization with the specified remote site.
Remarks

It is not necessary for all sites in a replication group to know about all other sites in the group.

This method may be called at any time during the life of an application.

View Source

SetAcknowledgmentPolicy(RecordAcknowledgmentPolicy)

Specifies how master and client sites will handle acknowledgment of replication messages which are necessary for "permanent" records.

Declaration
public void SetAcknowledgmentPolicy(RecordAcknowledgmentPolicy policy)
Parameters
Type Name Description
RecordAcknowledgmentPolicy policy

The acknowledgment policy to specify.
Remarks

The current implementation requires all sites in a replication group configure the same acknowledgment policy.

See Also
AcknowledgmentPolicy

SetLocalSite(String, UInt32)

Configures the host identification information for the local system.

Declaration
public void SetLocalSite(string host, uint port)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.String host

The site's host identification string.
System.UInt32 port

The port number on which the local site is listening.
Remarks

This method may not be called after the StartReplication method has been called.

View Source

SetPriority(UInt32)

Specifies the database environment's priority in replication group elections.

Declaration
public void SetPriority(uint priority)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.UInt32 priority

The replication priority of the environment.
Remarks

A special value of 0 indicates that this environment cannot be a replication group master.

Note that if the application never explicitly sets a priority, then a default value of 100 is used.

This method may be called at any time during the life of the application.

See Also
Priority
